commodities.dataaccess.dataloader
Class DailyDataLoaderFactory

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      commodities.dataaccess.dataloader.DailyDataLoaderFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class DailyDataLoaderFactory
extends Thread

This DailyDataLoaderFactory goes through all of the files that are located in the data folder and loads them into the Daily Price table. The factory is controlled by the naming structure of the files in the data folder. Property Name Valid Values ---------------------------- ------------ folder.commodity_data File path of where commodity data files are stored before loading to DB. folder.commodity_data_backup File path of where commodity data files are stored after loading to DB.

Version:
1.0
Author:
J.R. Titko
Updated:
2004.11.11

Method Detail

retrievePrices

public void retrievePrices()
Retrieve the prices from the internet.

retrievePrices

public void retrievePrices(boolean noThreads)
Retrieve the prices from the internet in a non-thread fashion so the program will shut down afterwards. The value for noThreads is irrelevant and is simply used to create an alternate signature.

getDirectoryList

public String[] getDirectoryList(String dirName)
Retrieve a filtered listing of file names from a directory.

Parameters:
dirName - The name of the directory

retrieveData

public void retrieveData()
Requests that prices get retrieved from their original sources by all the loaders from the maximum date in the database to today.

loadData

public void loadData()
Loads the data from a file to the database. The name format of the file directs how the file will be processed.

run

public void run()
Description copied from class: Thread
If this thread was constructed using a separate Runnable run object, then that Runnable object's run method is called; otherwise, this method does nothing and returns.

Subclasses of Thread should override this method.

See Also:
Thread.start(), Thread.stop(), Thread.Thread(java.lang.ThreadGroup, java.lang.Runnable, java.lang.String), Runnable.run()
